titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the standard deduction for child dependents.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/14/1988--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to revise the permitted amount of the standard deduction for a taxpayer's dependent who: (1) is either under age 19 or a student; and (2) has income and files a separate return. Makes the standard deduction equal to as much as $4,000 of earned income plus a maximum of $1,000 of unearned income. (Under current law, the permitted deduction is the greater of $500 or the dependent's actual earned income up to the regular standard deduction amount for individuals.)
